name: provencal
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of a dish) prepared using foods that are typical of the Provence region of France, for example, garlic, onions, tomatoes, and olive oil: The weekend market is a great place for freshly baked bread brushed with Provencal olive oil. Dishes include pasta carbonara, chicken provencal, and green Thai curry. The dish was served with rice and slices of tomatoes provençal. This dish is a kind of Provençal pizza.
relating to or in the French region of Provence: Aromas of lavender and pine drift into the carriage as the train doors open onto a Provencal evening. The property lies just two minutes from a charming Provencal village. The name derives from a Provençal word.
More examplesFewer examplesThere's no better place than this to taste the full range of Provencal cooking.In the past, true provencal aioli was made only with garlic and olive oil.You'll need 2 chopped onions, 2 cloves of garlic, 1 tablespoon of Provencal herbs, and 2 tablespoons of olive oil.
